name: Refreshing Lentil Salad
author: TUNISIANSWIFE
summary: I tried to duplicate this light, refreshing salad that my Tunisian in-laws make. I put my own 'twist' on this with the addition of lemon zest. Using colorful vegetables makes for a light salad with a beautiful presentation. Garnish with sliced hard-boiled eggs and serve with crusty baguettes.
ingredients: 2 large roma (plum) tomatoes, seeded and chopped
½ cup chopped green bell pepper
1  small green chile pepper, seeded and chopped
salt and ground black pepper to taste
2  hard-cooked eggs, cut in half lengthwise
directions: Bring the water and salt to a boil in a saucepan over high heat
Pour the lentils into the water while stirring constantly
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until the lentils are tender but still hold their shape, about 30 minutes
Transfer the lentils to a mixing bowl and stir in the garlic, seeded tomatoes, red onion, green bell pepper, and chile pepper
Add the juice of 1 lemon plus 1 teaspoon of the zest
Mix in the shredded carrot, olives, and cilantro
Season with salt and black pepper, and drizzle with olive oil; mix well
Refrigerate for at least an hour to allow the flavors to blend
Before serving, mix the salad again and add more lemon juice or olive oil if needed
Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with sliced eggs
